titleStmt.title: F. M. Kenady to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11946

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 80, Folder 864-65 GRANT COUNTY Recruiting & Raising Company 44th Rgt. Ky. Militia

body.p:
Covington Ky Decr 23d 1863
To his Excellency Thos H Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky
Sir

I have been solicited to act as Captain of a company of Mounted Inf. which I have the assurance can be raised in Grant County, to be organized under the law creating the State Guard of Kentucky, And I write you for the purpose of procuring ^a copy^ of the law, and any other information or instruction you may see proper to send me in regard to the matter --

I am Govenor
very Respectfully
Your Obt Servt
F. M. Kenady

State Guard
Kenton Co
F. M. Kenady
Desires to raise a Co in State Guard
Dec. 23. 1863
ans Dec 28-63
see letter book
Recd I. G. O. Dec 26, 1863
